{{cpp/identifier with special meaning/title|{{tt|module}} {{mark since c++20}}}}
{{cpp/keyword/navbar}}

===Usage===
* [[cpp/language/modules#Module declarations|{{tt|module}} declaration]]: declares that the current translation unit is a ''module unit''
* Starts a ''{{lsd|cpp/language/modules#Global module fragment}}'' of a module unit
* Starts a ''{{lsd|cpp/language/modules#Private module fragment}}'' of a module unit

===Example===
{{source|1=
module;            // starts a global module fragment

#include &lt;string&gt;

export module foo; // ends a global module fragment
                   // declares the primary module interface unit for named module 'foo'
                   // starts a module unit purview

export std::string f();

module : private;  // ends the portion of the module interface unit that
                   // can affect the behavior of other translation units
                   // starts a private module fragment

std::string f()
{
    return "foo";
}
}}
